definitions.definition: To bomb an area in such a manner that the ordnance covers the entire area without gaps.
definitions.example: The infantry were destroyed after the enemy carpet bombed the ground they were occupying.

definitions.definition: Excessive or immoderate indulgence of one's own personal desires and needs above all others.
Foolishness.
definitions.example: It'd be folly.

definitions.definition: Thoughtless action resulting in tragic consequence.
A fanciful building built for purely ornamental reasons.
A bulbous plant of the genus Narcissus, with yellow flowers and a trumpet shaped corona, especially Narcissus pseudonarcissus, the national flower of Wales.
A brilliant yellow color, like that of a daffodil.
Of a brilliant yellow color, like that of a daffodil.
Act of crowding anything into a lesser compass, or the state of being crowded or pressed together; condensation.
A state of the bowels in which the evacuations are infrequent and difficult, or the intestines become filled with hardened faeces; costiveness.
A network connection that requires a telephone number to be dialed.
(of a connection to a network, especially to the Internet) that requires a telephone number to be dialed
The part of a waistcoat etc. extending below the waist.
A woman's close-fitting bodice, underbodice, or corset having such a feature.
A signed document wherein an affiant makes a sworn statement.
definitions.example: He submitted his affidavit rather than appearing to testify in court.

definitions.definition: Typically a passenger vehicle modified to run and/or accelerate faster. The term may be used generically to apply to any car, truck, or motorcycle (et al.) modified for increased speed and/or performance. It may also be used to specifically describe and refer to modified cars from the original (or traditional) era of "hot rods", post World War II and prior to 1960.
(sexuality) The penis.
To modify a vehicle for enhanced driving performance, top speed, and/or to accelerate faster.
definitions.example: Are you going to hot rod [the vehicle] or leave it stock?

definitions.definition: The part of the body (of humans and quadrupeds) at each side of the backbone, between the ribs and hips
Any of several cuts of meat taken from this part of an animal
To be fooled by; to walk into (a trap) or respond to (a scam or trick).
definitions.example: I can't believe how many people still fall for the coin glued to the sidewalk.

definitions.definition: To fall in love with.
definitions.example: He really fell for the attractive waitress at his favorite restaurant.

definitions.definition: A toasted bread or cracker usually in the shape of a loose knot.
(by extension) Anything that is knotted, twisted, or tangled.
To bend, twist, or contort.
definitions.example: They discovered a snake pretzelled into knots.

definitions.definition: A friend, buddy, mate, cobber; someone to hang around with.
definitions.example: Little Timmy's out playing with his pals.

definitions.definition: An informal term of address, often used ironically in a hostile way.
definitions.example: Don't you threaten me, pal – I'll report you to the police.

definitions.definition: Be friends with, hang around with.
definitions.example: John plans to pal around with Joe today.

definitions.definition: A heroic verse.
Of or relating to a hero or heroine; supremely noble
definitions.example: heroic deeds

definitions.definition: Courageous; displaying heroism.
Of a size larger than life, but less than colossal.
To reserve or hold back nothing.
definitions.example: They pulled out all the stops for the gala wedding.

definitions.definition: Consideration or deliberation.
definitions.example: He took the situation under advisement, but was able to draw no conclusion.

definitions.definition: Advice, counsel.
A churchwarden.
A person (originally a man) of authority in a religious organization; a cleric.
A member or adherent of an established church, especially the Church of England.
A military cloak or long coat worn by soldiers or horsemen in the 16th and 17th centuries.
A coarse, loose cloak or gown, worn by women, sailors, shepherds, countryfolk etc.
An item of clerical clothing: a long, sheath-like, close-fitting, ankle-length robe worn by clergy members of some Christian denominations.
Someone who takes advantage of any opportunity to advance their own situation, placing expediency above principle.
Any of very many animals (either hermaphroditic or nonhermaphroditic), of the class Gastropoda, having a coiled shell.
(by extension) A slow person; a sluggard.
A spiral cam, or a flat piece of metal of spirally curved outline, used for giving motion to, or changing the position of, another part, as the hammer tail of a striking clock.
A tortoise or testudo; a movable roof or shed to protect besiegers.
The pod of the snail clover.
To move or travel very slowly.
definitions.example: The cars were snailing along the motorway during the rush hour.

definitions.definition: The blue grenadier (Macruronus novaezelandiae), a merluccid hake.
A routine visit to the doctor, dentist, or the like.
definitions.example: The appointment was just for a checkup.

definitions.definition: A routine inspection.
definitions.example: I took my car in for an annual checkup.

definitions.definition: A quantity that has magnitude but not direction; compare vector
An amplifier whose output is a constant multiple of its input
Having magnitude but not direction
Consisting of a single value (e.g. integer or string) rather than multiple values (e.g. array)
Of, or relating to scale
Of or pertaining to a musical scale.
A hole through which a button is pushed to secure a garment or some part of one.
A flower worn in a buttonhole for decoration.
A small slot-like cut or incision, made for example by an accident with the scalpel.
To detain (a person) in conversation against their will.
Without grace.
Lacking gracefulness
Unfortunate.
To make or form a cross.
To move relatively.
(social) To oppose.
To cross-fertilize or crossbreed.
definitions.example: They managed to cross a sheep with a goat.

definitions.definition: To stamp or mark (a cheque) in such a way as to prevent it being cashed, thus requiring it to be deposited into a bank account.
An intersection where roads, lines, or tracks cross.
A place at which a river, railroad, or highway may be crossed.
The act by which terrain or a road etc. is crossed.
A voyage across a body of water
The volume formed by the intersection of chancel, nave and transepts in a cruciform church; often with a tower or cupola over it
Movement into a crossed position.
A pair of intersecting edges.
A pair of parallel lines printed on a cheque
Extending or lying across; in a crosswise direction.
A set of skills.
The skills needed to accomplish a specified task or perform a given function.
Any of several Japanese breeds of cattle genetically predisposed to intense marbling and to producing a high percentage of oleaginous unsaturated fat.
A newspaper page containing signed articles by commentators expressing viewpoints that may not agree with those espoused by the editorial board, traditionally printed opposite the editorial page.
To write an op-ed article.
Of or being a newspaper page, usually opposite the editorial page, that features signed articles expressing personal viewpoints.
Of an article, written in a style suitable for publication as an op-ed.
Of a person, regularly expressing viewpoints by means of op-eds.
Dust which exists in outer space or has fallen from outer space to Earth.
A movie star
Not charitable
During every year; always
A disease spread by mosquito, in which a protozoan, Plasmodium, multiplies in blood every few days.
Supposed poisonous air arising from marshy districts, once thought to cause fever.
A river steamboat having a resident theatre.
(by extension) A showoff.
To show off.
Being in the nature of self-congratulation
A long, narrow ditch or hole dug in the ground.
A narrow excavation as used in warfare, as a cover for besieging or emplaced forces.
A pit, usually rectangular with smooth walls and floor, excavated during an archaeological investigation.
A trench coat.
(usually followed by upon) To invade, especially with regard to the rights or the exclusive authority of another; to encroach.
(infantry) To excavate an elongated pit for protection of soldiers and or equipment, usually perpendicular to the line of sight toward the enemy.
To excavate an elongated and often narrow pit.
To have direction; to aim or tend.
To cut; to form or shape by cutting; to make by incision, hewing, etc.
To cut furrows or ditches in.
definitions.example: to trench land for the purpose of draining it

definitions.definition: To dig or cultivate very deeply, usually by digging parallel contiguous trenches in succession, filling each from the next.
definitions.example: to trench a garden for certain crops

definitions.definition: A room, allocated as a children's play area, in which noisy or boisterous activities are tolerated.
(BDSM) A room dedicated to sadomasochistic sexual activity.
The contents of a cell except for the nucleus. It includes cytosol, organelles, vesicles, and the cytoskeleton.
To propose for consideration.
definitions.example: The Prime Minister put forward new plans to tackle corruption.

definitions.definition: To change the time in a time zone to a later time.
definitions.example: Don't forget that this Sunday we put the clocks forward an hour.

definitions.definition: To move along a surface (ice or ground) using skates.
To skateboard
To use the skating technique.
To get away with something; to be acquitted of a crime for which one is manifestly guilty.
The action of moving along a surface (ice or ground) using skates.
The sport of moving along a surface using skates.

A method of propulsion, where one moves similar to how a skater propels themselves. A technique in skiing, where a ski is planted diagonally, to push off of, and one slides forward on the ski facing straight foward, and then repeats the process with the swapping of the feet's actions.
Any of various caterpillars of moths that produce silk cocoons, especially Bombyx mori, the source of most commercial silk.
A false or misleading report or story, especially if deliberately so.
A type of aircraft in which the primary horizontal control and stabilization surfaces are in front of the main wing.
Any small winglike structure on a vehicle, usually used for stabilization.
To make timid or afraid; to cause to feel fear or nervousness; to deter, especially by threats of violence
definitions.example: He's trying to intimidate you. If you ignore him, hopefully he'll stop.

definitions.definition: Subjected to intimidation.
To take someone home by car; to give someone a lift to their house.
definitions.example: If you can wait a couple of minutes, I'll run you back.

definitions.definition: To rewind a film or cassette.
definitions.example: Can you run it back to the beginning, please?

definitions.definition: An offensive back whose primary job is to be the ballcarrier.
The act of repulsing or the state of being repulsed
Refusal, rejection or repulsion
To repel or drive back.
definitions.example: to repulse an assault; to repulse the enemy

definitions.definition: To reject or rebuff.
definitions.example: to repulse a suitor

definitions.definition: To cause revulsion in.
definitions.example: I find  your  conduct  reprehensible,  disgusting, and  it  repulses  me,  the  way  a  mongoose  repulses  a  snake.

definitions.definition: An act of spurning; a scornful rejection.
A kick; a blow with the foot.
Disdainful rejection; contemptuous treatment.
A body of coal left to sustain an overhanging mass.
To reject disdainfully; contemn; scorn.
To reject something by pushing it away with the foot.
To waste; fail to make the most of (an opportunity)
To kick or toss up the heels.
A system that centralizes, especially an administration of some kind.
In a painful manner; as if in pain.
definitions.example: I limped painfully down the stairs.

definitions.definition: Badly; poorly.
definitions.example: That was the most painfully sung rendition of “Fly Me to the Moon” that I’ve ever heard.

definitions.definition: A person with monastic ways; a monk.
Of or relating to monasteries or monks.
A temporary fence-like structure built around building work to add security and prevent accidents to the public.
A roofed wooden shield placed over the battlements of a castle and projecting from them.
A billboard.
To amass, usually for one's own private collection.
A behavior where people or animals accumulate food or other items
An anxiety disorder, of people who experience feelings of anxiety or discomfort about discarding unneeded items
(usually uncountable) A sweet chewing gum formulated to be stretchy so the chewer can blow bubbles with it.
(sometimes derogatory) A type of pop music marked by sweetness, pep and charm (rather than depth or complexity).
A light pink colour, like bubblegum.
Tasting like bubblegum
By extension, sweet, perky, or youthful
An underground railway, especially for mass transit of people in urban areas.
A train that runs on such an underground railway.
A rapid transit system, regardless of the elevation of its right of way.
An underground walkway, tunnel for pedestrians (called pedestrian underpass in US).
An underground route for pipes, sewers, etc.
To travel by underground railway.
(heading) To send someone away and forbid that person from returning.
To expel, especially from the mind.
definitions.example: banish fear, qualm.

definitions.definition: A person skilled at drawing engineering or architectural plans.
A book illustrator.
A piece in the game of draughts (checkers).
One who drinks drams; a tippler.
An invasive organism, as, a plant or animal.
That invades a foreign country using military force.
Relating to military aggression generally.
(of a plant or animal) That grows in environments which do not harbor natural enemies, often to the detriment of native species or of food or garden flora and fauna.
definitions.example: an invasive species

definitions.definition: (of a carcinoma etc) That invades healthy tissue; (of a procedure) in which part of the body is entered
Intrusive on one's privacy.
Coming from outside; originating externally.
An artificial diamond, strass.
definitions.example: Lucinda sewed rhinestones into her scarf to add a bit of flair.

definitions.definition: Made of or encrusted with rhinestones.
definitions.example: Karl wore a cowboy hat with a rhinestone hatband when he played his country and western gigs.

definitions.definition: Almsgiving, one of the five pillars of Islam.
A baked rice ball, filled with cheese or other sauce, originally from Sicily.
A high cover providing shelter, such as a cloth supported above an object, particularly over a bed.
Any overhanging or projecting roof structure, typically over entrances or doors.
The zone of the highest foliage and branches of a forest.
In an airplane, the transparent cockpit cover.
In a parachute, the cloth that fills with air and thus limits the falling speed.
To cover with or as if with a canopy.
To go through the canopy of a forest on a zipline.
A break between two performances or sessions, such as at a concert, play, seminar, or religious assembly.
The set of four defenders in a team.
definitions.example: it was a comfortable evening for the Gunners' back four.

definitions.definition: Fast, rapid, speedy.
With one's back facing that of somebody else.
definitions.example: Stand back to back so that we can see which of you is taller.

definitions.definition: Consecutively; one after the other.
definitions.example: We can't watch these films back to back! That's just way too much for one night.

definitions.definition: A house with a party wall at the rear.
Sequential or consecutive.
definitions.example: Ruth and Gehrig hit back-to-back home runs.

definitions.definition: With one's back facing that of somebody else.
(of a house) Having a party wall at the rear
definitions.example: We lived in a row of back-to-back houses.

definitions.definition: To impact directly, especially if violent.
definitions.example: When a body collides with another, then momentum is conserved.

definitions.definition: To come into conflict, or be incompatible.
definitions.example: China collided with the modern world.

definitions.definition: A national (or group) policy of non-interaction with other nations (or groups).
definitions.example: Before contact was initiated by the West, China followed a policy of isolationism.

definitions.definition: An ironic figure of speech whereby something is stated by denying its opposite, particularly the negation of a negative quality to say something positive.

The amount of time between the initiation of some process and its completion, e.g. the time required to manufacture or procure a product; the time required before something can be provided or delivered.
definitions.example: It's an excellent device, but it has a 10-week lead time, so be sure to order it in advance.

definitions.definition: Either of the two thick blue lines on the ice that separate an attacking zone or defending zone from the neutral zone.
A tall annual herb, Cannabis sativa, native to Asia.
Various products of this plant, including fibres and the drug cannabis.
A vertical tube or hollow column used to emit environmentally polluting gaseous and solid matter (including but not limited to by-products of burning carbon or hydrocarbon based fuels); a flue.
The glass flue surrounding the flame of an oil lamp.
The smokestack of a steam locomotive.
A narrow cleft in a rock face; a narrow vertical cave passage.
To negotiate a chimney (narrow vertical cave passage) by pushing against the sides with back, feet, hands, etc.
Characterized by accumulation; serving to collect or amass
Having a propensity to amass; acquisitive.
Not of the Christian faith.
Not in accord with Christian principles; without Christian spirit; unbefitting a Christian.
A muscle having four heads, especially the large extensor at the front of the thigh.
To relegate (something, especially a topic or a group of people) to the margins or to a lower limit; to exclude socially or otherwise.
To stream downward.
Lower down, in relation to a river, stream or flow of fluid
definitions.example: She lives downstream from the dam.

definitions.definition: In the direction from the server to the client.
Towards the 3' end of a DNA molecule.
(metaphoric) Influenced by something; being a consequence of something.
Following the path of a river or stream
definitions.example: We spent the day paddling downstream in our canoes.

definitions.definition: The time in the middle of the day when one stops one's activities (working, studying, etc) to have lunch.
A long, slender ship propelled primarily by oars, whether having masts and sails or not; usually referring to rowed warships used in the Mediterranean from the 16th century until the modern era.
A light, open boat used on the Thames by customhouse officers, press gangs, and also for pleasure.
One of the small boats carried by a man-of-war.
The cookroom or kitchen and cooking apparatus of a vessel or aircraft; sometimes on merchant vessels called the caboose.
An oblong oven or muffle with a battery of retorts; a gallery furnace.
An oblong tray of wood or brass, with upright sides, for holding type which has been set, or is to be made up, etc.
A proof sheet taken from type while on a galley; a galley proof.
A representation of a single masted ship propelled by oars, with three flags and a basket.
A vivid red synthetic pigment made of mercury sulfide.
A bright orange-red colour.
A type of red dye worn in the parting of the hair by married Hindu women.
The red skin of the lips or its border with the skin of the face.
The kermes or cochineal insect.
The cochineal dye made from this insect.
To color or paint vermilion.
Having a brilliant red colour.
Having the color of the vermilion dye.
Midday, noon
Midday
The traditional time, in the late afternoon, for serving tea (the meal).
(sometimes derogatory) An emigrant heading west on the Oregon Trail who gave up and turned back to the east.
A section of honeycomb that is unfinished and returned to the hive.
The act of turning to face in the other direction.
definitions.example: The basketball player made a turnaround jump shot

definitions.definition: A reversal of policy.
The time required to carry out a task.
definitions.example: They tried to reduce their turnaround on incoming paperwork.

definitions.definition: A turnabout; a reversal of circumstances.
A series of sketches of a character as seen from different angles.
A cadence linking the end of a verse to the beginning of the next.
The notation for the addition of a grace note above then below a given note.
The scheduled shutdown of an industrial plant, such as an oil rig, for maintenance and testing.
A contractual provision by which, if the studio elects to abandon a film project, the producer has a limited period in which to sell it elsewhere.
Preparations for takeoff, such as loading and servicing.
In terms of origin or development.
In a manner relating to genes or genetics.
definitions.example: Genetically modified crops.

definitions.definition: By being members of the same linguistic family.
definitions.example: German and Danish are genetically related.

definitions.definition: A derogatory hint or reference to a person or thing. An implication, intimation or insinuation.
definitions.example: She made a devious innuendo about her husband, who was embarrassed.

definitions.definition: A rhetorical device with an omitted, but obvious conclusion, made to increase the force of an argument.
Part of a pleading in cases of libel and slander, pointing out what and whom was meant by the libellous matter or description.
To interpret (something libellous or slanderous) in terms of what was implied.
